paragraphs.body: "The Blind Bandit" is the sixth episode of ${link_0} of ${link_1} and the 26th of the overall series. It debuted on May 5, 2006.
paragraphs.text: "The Blind Bandit" is the sixth episode of Book Two: Earth of Avatar: The Last Airbender and the 26th of the overall series. It debuted on May 5, 2006.

paragraphs.body: Aang searches for an earthbending teacher with little success. While at an earthbending tournament, he finds a talented blind earthbender girl named Toph, whom he had seen in a vision in the swamp. Unable to leave her overprotective parents, she cannot become Aang's instructor and, although she saves Aang after he is kidnapped, is forbidden from fighting any longer. To escape her plight, she runs away from home and joins the group, assuming her role as Aang's tutor.

paragraphs.body: At dinner, Aang, Katara, Sokka, and Master Yu have joined Toph and her family. Toph's father inquires of Aang how long he feels the ${link_0} will continue, and Aang explains he hopes to defeat the Fire Lord by summer. He is still, he tells them, in need of an earthbending teacher. Although Master Yu is mentioned as a candidate for Aang's teacher by Toph's father, Aang attempts to bring up the possibility of Toph as his teacher instead, but she hits Aang's foot with earthbending under the table to try to keep him quiet. paragraphs.body: Back at home, Toph tries to explain her secret identity to her parents, hoping it will not upset them. However, instead of taking her display as a token of autonomy and responsibility, they jump to the conclusion that the freedom they gave her allowed her to put herself into danger. They decide Toph has had too much freedom and must be confined and guarded from now on. Aang, Katara, and Sokka are forced out of the house, and Toph sheds tears for losing the possibility of gaining friends and what little freedom she had left.
